data.question: If the number of turns of a solenoid is doubled, its magnetic field strength:
The magnetic field at the center of a circular coil carrying current is:
Fleming’s left-hand rule is used to find:
data.op_4: Direction of force on a conductor
data.ans: Direction of force on a conductor

data.question: What is the role of split rings in an electric motor?
The strength of an electromagnet can be increased by:
data.op_2: Increasing current and number of turns
data.ans: Increasing current and number of turns

data.question: The direction of magnetic field lines inside a solenoid is:
A current-carrying conductor experiences maximum force in a magnetic field when:
data.op_1: It is parallel to the field
data.op_2: It is perpendicular to the field
data.op_3: It is at 45° to the field
data.ans: It is perpendicular to the field

data.question: Which of the following devices works on electromagnetic induction?
